alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 11:50AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River at Russian Mission. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...An ice jam about 25 mi downstream of Russian Mission is currently causing flooding in Russian Mission, including 1 foot of water over the runway and inundation of numerous homes in the lower part of the village. Local reports this morning indicate the river is now moving and water levels are slowly dropping, though flooding still persists. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM AKDT Wednesday, A pilot reported an ice jam remains in place on Yukon River below Russian Mission. As of Thursday morning, water levels remain high with flooding ongoing but is slowly receding. - A large surge of water and ice is currently moving down the Yukon River from ice jams that have released upriver near Ruby. Residents should be prepared for a long period of high water even after the ice jam releases. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River at Russian Mission stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
